New data from Israel shows that the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-21/pfizer-biontech-shot-stops-covid-s-spread-israeli-study-shows?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">effectively prevents</a></span><span> the transmission of Covid-19. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/economic-data-points-positive-economic-recovery?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Has the Economy Finally Turned It Around?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/economic-data-points-positive-economic-recovery" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the Earth on a turquoise background with two needles filled with a red serum (symbolizing vaccines) injecting it from either side" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTUwL2NvdmlkLTE5X3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If we had a dollar for every economic prediction that didn't pan out last year, we could single-handedly fund President Biden's stimulus plan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, the latest wave of economic data has some experts hoping that the US is not only on the rebound, but ahead of schedule. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The growing signs for optimism</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When investors are nervous about what's ahead, they typically buy US Treasury bonds, which sends bond prices higher and yields down. But last week, yields on the 10-year note <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-treasury-yields-renew-rise-on-positive-economic-data-11613757670?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed</a> to a one-year high, a sign that investors are bullish about a quicker rebound. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So are CEOs, whose confidence is at a 17-year high. Execs are <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/18/economy/ceo-business-confidence/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicting</a> fewer layoffs and a positive wage outlook, according to a recent Conference Board survey. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the consumer front...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Retail sales </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/19/stronger-economic-data-could-power-stocks-that-thrive-in-a-rebound-in-the-week-ahead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a></span><span> 5.3% in January, aided by the latest round of stimulus checks. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Households are sitting on ~$1.5 trillion in extra savings. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Employment in several blue-collar sectors—residential construction, delivery, and warehousing—</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/blue-collar-jobs-boom-as-covid-19-boosts-housing-e-commerce-demand-11613903402?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surpassed</a></span><span> pre-pandemic levels. Retail and restaurant jobs are also recovering.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Goldman Sachs recently upped its 2021 GDP forecast to 7%, but economists are <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/20/economy-growth-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still concerned</a> about the K-shaped recovery. 10 million fewer people are working now compared to last February, continuing unemployment claims are still elevated at 18.3 million, and consumer sentiment for those earning <$75,000 remains down.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What does this mean for more stimulus? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US government has spent $3.7 trillion since March, and Biden wants another $1.9 trillion. Given indicators of economic improvement, some experts are divided on whether more spending will trigger inflation or get the US out of a 20-year "low-growth rut." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen thinks we're still in "a deep hole." And when he testifies to the Senate and House finance committees this week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell is expected to continue pressing for more action.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/texans-face-exorbitant-electricity-bills-following-energy-crisis?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Texans Looking at Their Electricity Bills
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/texans-face-exorbitant-electricity-bills-following-energy-crisis" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Larry David saying "what?" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/J5duvMVCOUaMd5ZG1i/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Larry David saying "what?" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/J5duvMVCOUaMd5ZG1i/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most Texans have their lights back on following a harrowing week in which frigid temperatures + energy grid failures contributed to prolonged blackouts. But now, some are facing a <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-winter-storms-2021/2021/02/21/969912613/after-days-of-mass-outages-some-texas-residents-now-face-huge-electric-bills?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whole new disaster</a>: astronomical electricity bills. A few examples:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An HR director was </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-20/texas-homes-slammed-with-thousand-dollar-bills-after-winter-woe?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">charged $2,739</a></span><span> this month after paying $130 in January.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A Dallas resident is facing a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/20/business/texas-electricity-bills-griddy-puct/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$7,000 bill</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A retired Army vet is stuck with a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/20/us/texas-storm-electric-bills.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$16,752 electric bill</a></span><span>, 70x what he typically pays for utilities.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How could that happen? Many Texans facing exorbitant charges were customers of power supplier Griddy, whose prices fluctuate with the wholesale energy market. When energy prices skyrocketed last weekend, Griddy knew its customers were in for a painful surprise and even encouraged them to switch providers if they could.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Texas Gov. Greg Abbott held an emergency meeting on Saturday to see what lawmakers could do to provide relief. And Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/21/texas-storm-houston-mayor-says-state-of-texas-should-pay-for-high-energy-bills.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the state of Texas should "bear the responsibility" of paying the egregiously high bills. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The best news bites you missed this weekend in the form of one stat, one quote, and one read.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The Chinese box office <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/news/chinese-new-year-box-office-hi-mom-detective-chinatown-3-1234910170/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generated $1.2 billion</a> in ticket sales over the recent Lunar New Year holiday, a record haul and equivalent to about 10% of the total global box office last year. <em>Detective Chinatown 3 </em>had the biggest opening ever for a film in a single market, topping even <em>Avengers: Endgame</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"BTC & ETH do seem high lol"—Elon Musk, despite being a crypto bull, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/20/elon-musk-says-bitcoin-seems-high-after-surpassing-1-trillion-market-cap.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> that surging bitcoin and ethereum prices might be overdoing it a little. For once, though, his tweets went ignored: Both cryptocurrencies hit record highs this weekend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A financial crisis is heading for the legendary soccer club, Barcelona. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/12/sports/soccer/barcelona-messi-contract.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY CHOBANI
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Time Traveled to Tell Our Great Great Great Grandpa About This
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1068.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25337493.294453364;dc_trk_aid=487343606;dc_trk_cid=145099655;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Chobani" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjM4Ny8xNjExOTQ0NTg4LTE1MDB4ODUwX05ld3NsZXR0ZXJfQ2hvYmFuaS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When we heard that <strong style="color:#000">now through the end of February</strong>, Chobani is giving fans the opportunity to <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1068.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25337493.294453364;dc_trk_aid=487343606;dc_trk_cid=145099655;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dream up the Coffee Creamer flavor of their fantasies</a> for a chance to <strong style="color:#000">win $75,000</strong>, we immediately did two things:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Began our Coffee Creamer flavor brainstorm</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Built a time machine to travel to the Yukon Territory in 1898 and tell Great Great Great Grandpa Harold that there’s an easier way to make his fortune</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We couldn’t sit around making our fortune by dreaming up Coffee Creamer flavors while Harold broke his back panning for gold. No, we drove that time machine straight to Harold and told him, “Hop in, Gramps. We got some Coffee Creamer flavors to dream up.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now we’re all sittin’ around the table at Brew HQ, dreaming up <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1068.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25337493.294453364;dc_trk_aid=487343606;dc_trk_cid=145099655;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a flavor for a chance to win this contest</a> and <strong style="color:#000">live on shelves IRL</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think you can beat us? <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1068.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25337493.294453364;dc_trk_aid=487343606;dc_trk_cid=145099655;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Submit your dream Chobani® Coffee Creamer flavor here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/coinbase-stripe-valued-100b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Too Late to Declare 2021 the Year of Fintech?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/coinbase-stripe-valued-100b" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Coinbase at the New York Stock Exchange " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDU3L2NvaW5iYXNlX2lwby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nothing against the ox, but two of Silicon Valley's mega-startups are getting ready for their Wall Street cotillion, and new reports say they're already commanding nine-figure valuations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">First up, Coinbase</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ahead of its planned direct listing, investors are <a href="https://www.axios.com/coinbase-valued-100-billion-direct-listing-9b43e316-7ff7-4f6a-a1db-4dc2481a93ee.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">valuing</a> Coinbase at $100+ billion, which would make it the biggest US tech listing since Facebook, per Axios. As the first US-based crypto exchange to go public, it'll also confer major legitimacy to digital currencies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coinbase has licenses to operate in over 40 states and 100+ countries. And in the first nine months of 2020, it did $141 million in profit... </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...and that was before bitcoin started shooting up like bamboo. The crypto has risen ~96% YTD and is pushing $58k. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Next is Stripe</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to the pandemic-fueled e-commerce boom, Stripe processed an estimated 50% more payments last year. Investors are <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffkauflin/2021/02/17/investors-are-now-valuing-stripe-at-115-billion/?sh=27b24b947860&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">valuing</a> the company at $115 billion in the secondary market, more than 3x its valuation from last April.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This weekend, Stripe announced that former Bank of England Gov. Mark Carney is joining the board. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>With Ant Group's IPO <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-blocked-jack-mas-ant-ipo-after-an-investigation-revealed-who-stood-to-gain-11613491292?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blocked</a> by Chinese regulators, American fintechs may steal the show. SoFi is going public via SPAC, and while Robinhood is...working through some things...it hasn't ruled out a 2021 IPO. </p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stimulus: </strong>The House could vote on Biden's $1.9 trillion stimulus package <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-house-democrats-want-a-stimulus-vote-later-next-week-2021-2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this week</a>, per House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. As a reminder, the bill includes direct payments of up to $1,400 and $400/week in extra unemployment benefits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Powell testimony: </strong>Fed Chair Jerome Powell will try for a Roaring Kitty-like performance when he testifies on Capitol Hill on Tuesday and Wednesday about the state of the economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Should be a fun week, with lots of big retail names (Home Depot, Etsy, Lowe's, TJX, Best Buy) and plenty of others (Nvidia, Square, Salesforce). On Thursday, Airbnb and DoorDash will deliver their first earnings reports since going public.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) starts Wednesday. Former President Trump is expected to deliver a speech on Sunday. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Warren Buffett will release his famous annual shareholder letter on Saturday.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Chag sameach to our Jewish readers celebrating Purim Thursday night. Let us know if you've got any fun costumes planned.</span></li>
</ul>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore great news on the vaccine front. New data from Israel shows that the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-21/pfizer-biontech-shot-stops-covid-s-spread-israeli-study-shows?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeffectively prevents\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the transmission of Covid-19. Although it's not yet peer-reviewed, the study is the first sign that vaccines can stop asymptomatic carriers from passing on the coronavirus.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe S\u0026P hopes to hop back on the winning train after posting its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/21/stock-market-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst weekly loss\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in three. Financials, industrials, and airlines have been standouts even as the broader market couldn't find its legs. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf we had a dollar for every economic prediction that didn't pan out last year, we could single-handedly fund President Biden's stimulus plan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, the latest wave of economic data has some experts hoping that the US is not only on the rebound, but ahead of schedule. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe growing signs for optimism\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen investors are nervous about what's ahead, they typically buy US Treasury bonds, which sends bond prices higher and yields down. But last week, yields on the 10-year note \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-treasury-yields-renew-rise-on-positive-economic-data-11613757670?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbed\u003c/a\u003e to a one-year high, a sign that investors are bullish about a quicker rebound. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo are CEOs, whose confidence is at a 17-year high. Execs are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/18/economy/ceo-business-confidence/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicting\u003c/a\u003e fewer layoffs and a positive wage outlook, according to a recent Conference Board survey. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn the consumer front...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRetail sales \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/19/stronger-economic-data-could-power-stocks-that-thrive-in-a-rebound-in-the-week-ahead.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 5.3% in January, aided by the latest round of stimulus checks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHouseholds are sitting on ~$1.5 trillion in extra savings. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEmployment in several blue-collar sectors—residential construction, delivery, and warehousing—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/blue-collar-jobs-boom-as-covid-19-boosts-housing-e-commerce-demand-11613903402?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurpassed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e pre-pandemic levels. Retail and restaurant jobs are also recovering.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eGoldman Sachs recently upped its 2021 GDP forecast to 7%, but economists are \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/20/economy-growth-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill concerned\u003c/a\u003e about the K-shaped recovery. 10 million fewer people are working now compared to last February, continuing unemployment claims are still elevated at 18.3 million, and consumer sentiment for those earning \u003c$75,000 remains down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat does this mean for more stimulus? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US government has spent $3.7 trillion since March, and Biden wants another $1.9 trillion. Given indicators of economic improvement, some experts are divided on whether more spending will trigger inflation or get the US out of a 20-year \"low-growth rut.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTreasury Sec. Janet Yellen thinks we're still in \"a deep hole.\" And when he testifies to the Senate and House finance committees this week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell is expected to continue pressing for more action.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost Texans have their lights back on following a harrowing week in which frigid temperatures + energy grid failures contributed to prolonged blackouts. But now, some are facing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-winter-storms-2021/2021/02/21/969912613/after-days-of-mass-outages-some-texas-residents-now-face-huge-electric-bills?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhole new disaster\u003c/a\u003e: astronomical electricity bills. A few examples:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAn HR director was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-20/texas-homes-slammed-with-thousand-dollar-bills-after-winter-woe?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echarged $2,739\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this month after paying $130 in January.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA Dallas resident is facing a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/20/business/texas-electricity-bills-griddy-puct/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$7,000 bill\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA retired Army vet is stuck with a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/20/us/texas-storm-electric-bills.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$16,752 electric bill\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, 70x what he typically pays for utilities.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow could that happen? Many Texans facing exorbitant charges were customers of power supplier Griddy, whose prices fluctuate with the wholesale energy market. When energy prices skyrocketed last weekend, Griddy knew its customers were in for a painful surprise and even encouraged them to switch providers if they could.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eTexas Gov. Greg Abbott held an emergency meeting on Saturday to see what lawmakers could do to provide relief. And Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/21/texas-storm-houston-mayor-says-state-of-texas-should-pay-for-high-energy-bills.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e the state of Texas should \"bear the responsibility\" of paying the egregiously high bills. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" mega-startups are getting ready for their Wall Street cotillion, and new reports say they're already commanding nine-figure valuations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFirst up, Coinbase\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAhead of its planned direct listing, investors are \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coinbase-valued-100-billion-direct-listing-9b43e316-7ff7-4f6a-a1db-4dc2481a93ee.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evaluing\u003c/a\u003e Coinbase at $100+ billion, which would make it the biggest US tech listing since Facebook, per Axios. As the first US-based crypto exchange to go public, it'll also confer major legitimacy to digital currencies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCoinbase has licenses to operate in over 40 states and 100+ countries. And in the first nine months of 2020, it did $141 million in profit... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...and that was before bitcoin started shooting up like bamboo. The crypto has risen ~96% YTD and is pushing $58k. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNext is Stripe\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to the pandemic-fueled e-commerce boom, Stripe processed an estimated 50% more payments last year. Investors are \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffkauflin/2021/02/17/investors-are-now-valuing-stripe-at-115-billion/?sh=27b24b947860\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evaluing\u003c/a\u003e the company at $115 billion in the secondary market, more than 3x its valuation from last April.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis weekend, Stripe announced that former Bank of England Gov. Mark Carney is joining the board. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWith Ant Group's IPO \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-blocked-jack-mas-ant-ipo-after-an-investigation-revealed-who-stood-to-gain-11613491292?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblocked\u003c/a\u003e by Chinese regulators, American fintechs may steal the show.
